Chinese electric vehicle maker NIO wants to be an electric battery maker too. It's a strategy employed by most auto makers these days and the trend is a little unnerving to the world's biggest battery maker. $NIO NIO plans to build its first EV battery plant that will have a capacity of 40 gigawatt hours a year, Reuters reported Friday. NIO didn't immediately respond to a request for comment about the plans. Car company owned battery capacity can mean less business down the road for current NIO supplier, and world's largest battery producer, Contemporary Amperex Technology Co (300750.China), better know as CATL.

Quick thread comparing  $NIO & $TSLA  $TSLA has become a popular stock with its premium electric vehicles in the US. $NIO, a Chinese EV manufacturer, is taking a similar approach. NIO designs, manufactures, and sells high-priced electric vehicles, aiming to create a community of environmentally-conscious drivers. The company is investing in innovative features like 3-minute battery swapping terminals and autonomous driving software. $NIO financial results are improving, and it plans to release a lower-priced, mass-market car by 2024. However, China's escalating risk profile poses challenges. The Chinese EV market is fast-growing and fragmented, with 6.5 million new electric vehicles sold in 2022, a 96% increase over 2021. NIO delivered 122,486 vehicles in 2022, a 34% increase over 2021, despite COVID-related supply disruptions. Risks include China's zero-COVID policies affecting production and competition from both domestic and foreign players. However, NIO's ambitious leadership, new models, and innovative technologies make it an investment opportunity to consider.

$NIO Inc. Provides April 2023 Delivery Update: The company delivered 6,658 vehicles in April 2023, an increase of 31.2% YoY, consisting of 1,713 premium smart electric SUVs and 4,945 premium smart electric sedans. NIO has been upgrading its product offerings from NIO Technology 1.0 (NT1.0) to NIO Technology 2.0 (NT2.0), with the majority of deliveries in April 2023 attributable to ET5 and ES7. The company has started to ramp up production and delivery of the EC7, a five-seater smart electric flagship coupe SUV from NT2.0. NIO also debuted the All-New ES6, a smart electric all-round SUV, at the Shanghai Auto Show, which is expected to be launched and delivered in May 2023. The All-New ES8, a smart electric flagship SUV, is expected to be delivered in June 2023. Finally, NIO launched the 2023 ET7, a smart electric flagship sedan with over 15 product upgrades, and deliveries will start in May 2023.
